security_audit.summary: Pure markdown prompt-based skill with no executable code. Only uses standard Read/Write tools for text processing. No scripts, network calls, filesystem access beyond tool permissions, environment variables, or code execution paths.

content.user_title: Map customer decision moments for optimized funnels
content.value_statement: Marketing teams struggle to understand where prospects are in their buying journey. This skill maps decision moments across Awareness, Consideration, Conversion, and Retention stages, then recommends specific assets to move prospects toward purchase.
actual_capabilities: Create structured customer journey maps across 6 decision stages
Define decision moments with problem statements, objections, and proof requirements
Recommend asset types for each stage (content, videos, demos, testimonials)
Build multi-channel execution maps (email, ads, social, landing pages)
Align funnels with No-Bluff protocol for verified value propositions
Design retention systems to maximize customer lifetime value
limitations: Does not generate actual marketing content or assets
Requires user to provide offer details and target audience context
Output is a strategic framework, not automated implementation
Does not integrate with analytics platforms for data import

use_cases.title: Design conversion funnels
use_cases.description: Map decision moments for new campaigns and identify asset gaps across the customer journey.

use_cases.title: Optimize onboarding flows
use_cases.description: Create structured retention journeys that maximize customer lifetime value and reduce churn.

use_cases.title: Match content to stages
use_cases.description: Produce the right content type for each decision moment based on proven frameworks.

prompt_templates.title: Basic funnel creation
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a decision moment map for [offer/product] targeting [audience]. Map the journey from awareness to retention.

prompt_templates.title: Conversion optimization
prompt_templates.prompt: Analyze our current [email/ad] funnel and identify decision moments that may be missing or underoptimized.

prompt_templates.title: Multi-channel mapping
prompt_templates.prompt: Build an execution map showing which channels (email, social, ads, landing pages) should carry each decision moment.

prompt_templates.title: Retention system design
prompt_templates.prompt: Design a retention system with decision moments that maximize lifetime value for customers after purchase.

output_examples.input: Create a decision moment map for a SaaS email course targeting freelance designers.
output: **Journey Map**: Awareness (problem identification) â†’ Problem Aware (naming the struggle) â†’ Solution Aware (discovering email courses) â†’ Provider Aware (choosing our course) â†’ Purchase (enrollment) â†’ Retention (skill mastery)

**Key Decision Moments**: 1) 'I have design blocks' problem awareness 2) 'Email courses could help' solution awareness 3) 'This specific course is best' provider selection 4) 'Ready to commit' purchase decision

**Asset Recommendations**: Stage 1: Social posts about freelance struggles. Stage 2: Comparison guide (video vs course vs coaching). Stage 3: Free lesson preview + testimonials. Stage 4: Limited-time enrollment offer. Stage 5: Onboarding sequence + tutorial content.

best_practices: Provide specific details about your offer, target audience, and existing marketing assets
Use the No-Bluff protocol to ensure value propositions are verified before mapping
Iterate on the map by adding more decision moments for complex buying cycles
anti_patterns: Using vague prompts without specific offer or audience details
Skipping the problem awareness stage assuming prospects already know their pain points
Creating overly complex maps with more than 8 decision moments per funnel

faq.question: Which AI tools support this skill?
faq.answer: Works with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code. Use Read tool to access prompt, then Write tool for outputs.

faq.question: How many decision moments should a funnel have?
faq.answer: Most funnels work best with 4 to 8 decision moments. Too few misses nuance. Too many creates complexity.

faq.question: Can this skill generate actual content?
faq.answer: No. This skill creates strategic frameworks. Use Social Playbook skill to generate actual content assets.

faq.question: Is customer data safe?
faq.answer: Yes. This is a prompt-based skill with no code execution. No data leaves your session.

faq.question: What if prospects skip stages?
faq.answer: Map the happy path first. Add "skip logic" decision moments where you account for returning visitors and direct responders.

faq.question: How is this different from Social Playbook?
faq.answer: Social Playbook creates content. Decision Moment maps strategy. Use together: map moments first, then generate content for each.
